poem:
### The Allure of Want

In the hollowed valleys  
of want, where the wind  
whispers through larches,  
a brush of exotic wealth  
beckons the spirit,  
its allure in cellulose dream,  
coloured like stolen dawns.  
The boar's breath  
meets the hair of desire;  
are we not drawn  
to what we might  
never need, but still crave?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "I do not need a £100 hairbrush. So why have I spent so long fantasising about one? I recently found myself fantasising about buying a hairbrush that costs more than £100. It is a very beautiful hairbrush: it comes in a choice of seductive colours and it is fashioned from the keratin-rich fibres of south-east Asian boar and from biodegradable cellulose acetate (entirely free of petrochemicals). It was advertised to me on social media and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
